page.title: 02Merebrow and District.
page.content: Merebrow is a small village. The countryside surrounding it is mostly flat, except for a hill down 'Marshes Lane'. 'Mere' means lake and 'brow' means hill. From that we know that in Merebrow there used to be a lake that stopped at the hill. The farms of Holmes, the oldest area, are on the highest part which was also an island in this lake area. Some of Merebrow is deciduous wood land . The soil is rich and when it is turned over it is very black. It is used for growing vegetables and cereal crops. Most of the land is owned by Lord Lilford. On part of the area many people enjoy a day out at the Leisure Lakes. Here you can fish, sail boats, wind surf, fly model planes canoe and camp. In this part there is also a Fruit Farm where people come to pick soft fruit and vegetables.
